meanings.definition: The study or appreciation of music
meanings.sent1: She immersed herself in the world of philharmonics, learning about different composers and musical styles.
meanings.sent2: The community center offers classes in philharmonics for those interested in understanding music better.
meanings.sent3: When asked about his favorite hobby, John jokingly replied, 'I'm a professional in philharmonics - I listen to music all day!'
meanings.sent4: Her heart danced to the philharmonics of the orchestra, each note painting a vivid picture in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of philharmonics filled the concert hall, enchanting all who listened.

meanings.definition: A symphony orchestra or the group of musicians who play in one
meanings.sent1: The philharmonics performed a breathtaking concert, captivating the audience with their music.
meanings.sent2: She dreamed of joining the philharmonics one day and playing her violin on stage.
meanings.sent3: The philharmonics were so in sync during the performance that it seemed like they were reading each other's minds.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sounds of the philharmonics echoed through the park, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The conductor led the philharmonics with passion and precision, creating a symphony of harmony.
